column3: 给小主请安 小主吉祥
column6: Peace to you, My Lady.
Where are we?
We are at the side gate of the North Entrance.
The side gate?

column3: 只有皇后才能从大清的正门进入
column6: Only Her Majesty the Empress can use the main gate.
Meizhuang!

column3: 小主 此刻不是说话的时候
会有公公带你们去各自的宫室
column6: My Lady, you will have time to catch up later.

column3: 内务府已经把各位小主的行李

column6:
Your baggage has been delivered to your residence.
Please follow us.
Where does Attendant Sourire live?
The Palace of Pearl Jade.

column3: 小主 请安心地去吧
column6: Farewell, My Lady.
Please follow me, Attendant Sourire.
Please follow me, Companion An.
Please follow me, Lady Shen.

column3: 好漂亮 难怪人人都想进紫禁城
column6: It's splendid! No wonder everyone wants to live in the palace.

column3: 鸿雁高飞 这可是好兆头啊
column6: My Lady, wild geese is a sign of good luck.

column3: 小主 赶紧走吧 还远着呢
column6: I hope you are excited about your new home.
Peace to you, My Lady.
You may rise.

column3: 贵人 这就是您的常熙堂了
column6: Thank you, My Lady.
My Lady, this is your residence, Chamber of Brilliance.
Thank you.

column3: 公公我们小主请您喝茶
column6: Sir, please treat yourself to a cup of tea.
Thank you, My Lady. Please enter.
It's getting gloomy.
Not at all, it's a quiet place.
That will be good for you, My Lady.
My Lady, this is your residence.
Thank you, sir.
Take care.
How did you get in?
What a small palace for enemies!
Huh, a Companion are you?

column3: 安答应里面已经收拾好了
您的包袱敬事房已经先送到了
column6: Companion An, everything's ready in your room.
Greetings, Dongchun.

column3: 别 我可当不起你这姐姐
column6: No.
Don't you address me like a friend!
Peace to Attendant Xia.
Peace to you, Attendant Xia.
That is how you greet me.

column3: 小主我看我们先进去吧
column6: My Lady, please come see your room.

column3: 回禀小主 就是这儿了
column6: This is your palace.

column3: 像是新整修过的样子 挺漂亮的
column6: Looks nice. It seems newly renovated.

column3: 这可是皇上刚登基的时候

column6:
It was. The palace was assigned to
Lady Parfum after His Majesty's coronation.

column3: 那芳贵人也住在里面了
column6: So we are living with Lady Parfum?
(hesitates) Please, My Lady.
Attendant Sourire.

column3: 奴才们恭迎小主小主吉祥
column6: Peace to My Lady.
You may rise.

column3: 小主既是到了 那就请先歇息吧
column6: It was a long trip.
Have a good rest, My Lady.
Thank you.

column3: 今儿一早就开始打扫了

column6:
My Lady, I hope you like your palace.
We cleaned it thoroughly this morning.

column3: 碎玉轩 名字也别致
column6:
Palace of Pearl Jade.
I like its name.

column3: 正殿两边啊 是东西配殿
column6:
My Lady, this is the main chamber.
On its east and west are the side chambers.
Behind it is the bedchamber and a garden.
On the south of the main chamber is your summer residence.

The palace was named for its pear flowers,
which look like falling pieces of jade.

column3: 那海棠开红花甚是喜庆
column6:
And the crabapple trees bear bright red flowers
and look very festive.

column3: 这儿怎么还有个戏台子
column6: Why is there a stage?

column3: 原来宫里的嫔妃们都爱看戏

column6: There are many theaters in the palace for the concubines.

This one became less frequented,
so it was built into a residence.
(sidetracks) How do you like the palace, My Lady?
It's very calming.

column3: 禀小主这是新贡的金桂

column6:
My Lady, Her Majesty the Empress
had the sweet olive trees planted for you.

column3: 以示新贵入主 后宫吉庆
column6: She wishes you a sweet life in the palace.
Exactly.
It was very kind of Her Majesty.
Please enter the main chamber, My Lady.

column3: 奴才碎玉轩首领太监康禄海

column6:
My name is Kang Luhai.
I'm the head eunuch of your palace.
Peace to you, My Lady.

column3: 奴婢碎玉轩掌事宫女崔槿汐

column6:
My name is Cui Jinxi.
I'm the head maid of your palace.
May peace be with you.
Please rise.

column3: 不是说这里还住着一位芳贵人吗
column6:
—Yes.
—Thank you, My Lady.

column3: 先带我去向芳贵人请安吧
column6:
I was told that Lady Parfum lives here as well.
I should pay respect to her right away.

column3: 芳贵人已不住在碎玉轩
column6: My Lady, Lady Parfum does not live here any more.

column3: 现如今西配殿是空着的
column6: Her west chamber is vacant.
Attendant Chun moved into the east chamber four days ago.

column3: 晚些时候自会前来与小主相见
column6: She will visit you later.
My Lady, this is Xiao-Yunzi.

column3: 这二位是康禄海的徒弟

column6:
These two are apprentices to Mr. Kang:
Xiao-Hezi and Xiao-Yinzi.
These are your maids: Violet and Daisy.
They are all at your service.
May peace and grace be with you, My Lady.

column3: 今后你们便是我的人了
column6: It was nice to meet every one of you.

column3: 在我名下当差伶俐自然是好
column6: I do expect my servants to be smart and efficient.
But what I require is absolute loyalty.
(Yes x3)
Do you understand?

column3: 奴才们必当忠心耿耿 绝无二心
column6: Yes, My Lady.
(whisper) Go ahead.

column3: 小主今儿也累了 请先歇了吧
column6:
My Lady, you must be tired from the trip.
Would you like to take a rest?
Yes, you may leave.

column3: 崔姑姑入宫有些日子了吧
column6: Madam Cui, you must have been in the palace for a while.

column3: 小主还是直呼奴婢贱名
column6: My Lady, please call me by my humble name—Jinxi.

column3: 我一向是没规矩惯了的
column6: Madam, please stand.
Please don't be inhibited by the rules.

column3: 可是你比我年长 阅历又多

column6:
You are my elder and more experienced in the palace.
I should be respectful to you.

column3: 奴婢先前是侍服太妃的
column6: I'm not worthy of your courtesy, My Lady.

I used to serve the concubines of the prior emperor.
It's my pleasure to work for you.

column3: 服侍过太妃的人必然稳妥
column6: You must be a reliable person for your extended service in the palace.
I'm flattered, My Lady.

column3: 就要有劳你与康公公一同打理了
column6: Thank you for taking care of my palace with Mr. Kang.

column3: 小主放心奴婢定尽心竭力
column6: My Lady, I will spare no effort.

column3: 让流朱和浣碧服侍更衣就是
column6:
Please go have a break.
Vermilion and Jade will take over.
Thank you, My Lady.

column3: 快坐下吧 拘束一天了
column6: (sigh of relief) What a stressful day!

column3: 可吓坏我了 宫里好大的规矩
column6:
There were a whole lot of rules!
It was so scary.

column3: 你可别光顾着看哪 规矩要紧
column6: But the room's so nice.

column3: 你们俩是我带进宫来的
column6: You must be careful not to break any rules.

column3: 这说话举止都要格外小心
column6: You two have to be exceedingly careful as my dowry maids.
For sure!

column3: 只要管住她的快嘴就是了
column6: Vermilion always speaks without thinking.

column3: 她的嘴虽快 但也不坏事
column6: Get out of here!

column3: 知道什么能说 什么不能说
column6: It's not that bad. She knows how to talk properly.

column3: 你们俩是自幼和我一同长大的

column6: We grew up as a family, and moved here together.

column3: 就有如盲人走在悬崖峭壁边
column6:
Living in the palace is like walking along a cliff with
our eyes covered. We have to trust and help each other.

column3: 咱们三人是一荣俱荣 一损俱损
column6: We are all in the same boat.

column3: 我知道小主待我们如亲姐妹一般
我和浣碧一定好好护着小主
column6:
You treat us like your sisters.
We will protect you at our best.
I will take good care of you both as well.
Please don't worry, My Lady.

column3: 娘娘看了一上午的书了

column6: Your Majesty, would you like a break and some tangerines?

column3: 新入宫的嫔妃都安顿好了吧
column6: The new concubines must have settled in by now.

column3: 是 都已经到各自宫里歇息了
column6: Yes, everything went well.

I can finally have some time to myself
when Consort Fleur is taking care of the palace.
She's the only thing Your Majesty should worry about.

column3: 偏偏被华妃宫里的颂芝给挑走了
column6: Song Zhi took away the pomelos and gave us the tangerines.

column3: 还道皇上午后要去她们宫里用膳

column6:
She claimed that her palace deserves the best
because His Majesty will eat there.

column3: 苏州织造新进贡的缎子
column6: And last time,

column3: 也是让她们宫里先挑走的
column6:
when Suzhou Clothing Services supplied textiles,
she got to be the first one to choose.

column3: 让一让她又有什么要紧
column6: Not a big deal. Just let her be.

column3: 外面庭院里的牡丹都有些歪了
column6: The peonies in the yard need to be taken better care of.
Please inform the gardeners.
But ...
Her Majesty can't be bothered to care about her.
Where's Vermilion?

column3: 早上的时候小主嘱咐小厨房
column6:
My Lady, you sent her to bring some pastries
to Lady Shen and Companion An.

column3: 让流朱给沈贵人和安答应送去
这不 刚走了一会儿呢
column6:
The kitchen just finished making the pastries,
and Vermilion is on her way.

My Lady, Madam Autumn sends you housewarming gifts
on behalf of Her Majesty the Empress.

column3: 请您三日后卯时到景仁宫觐见
column6:
You are required to greet Her Majesty in the Palace of
Great Benevolence at five am after three days.
I understand.

column3: 还有 翊坤宫首领太监周公公
column6: Mr. Zhou from the Palace of Earthly Honors is here.
Palace of Earthly Honors?
That's Consort Fleur's palace.
I see.

- I will be there shortly.
- Aye.

column3: 小主 华妃与皇后分庭抗礼
column6:
My Lady, Consort Fleur is on a par with Her Majesty.
You cannot show any disrespect.
It's very nice to see you, sir.
Please.
Peace to Attendant Sourire.
Thanks for the wait, Mr. Zhou.

column3: 华妃娘娘命奴才给您送些礼物来
column6: Her Highness Consort Fleur sends you some gifts.

column3: 有劳公公向娘娘转达嫔妾的谢意
column6: Thank you, and please thank Her Highness for me.
Would you like to sit down for a cup of tea, sir?

column3: 奴才呢 还得给别的小主送赏去
column6: I would love to, but I have to visit other concubines.
I'm afraid I have to go now.
Thank you for coming, sir.
I bid you a good day, My Lady.

column3: 华妃娘娘对小主青眼有加
column6:
Congratulations, My Lady.
Her Highness was very generous.

column3: 这些东西一时也用不着

column6: Please make a record of the gifts and keep them in the storeroom.
My Lady, you received as many gifts as Lady Shen.

column3: 也只有富察贵人和夏常在才有呢
column6:
And Lady Fuca and Attendant Xia
in Companion An's palace.
Consort Fleur must be trying to buy over the new concubines.
Peace to Attendant Xia.

Madam Autumn, you shouldn't have visited personally.
Come on in!

column3: 小主们初来宫中怕不习惯
所以特地让奴婢过来看看
column6:
Her Majesty will be happy to know that
you are pleased with everything in the palace.

column3: 江南织造局进贡的料子

column6: I hope you like the textiles from Southern Clothing Services.

column3: 皇后厚爱 还让姑姑亲自送来

column6:
Thank you and thank Her Majesty.
I am extremely flattered!

column3: 小主客气了那奴婢告辞了
column6: You are welcome. Allow me to take my leave.
Take care, Madam.
Goodbye, My Lady.

column3: 就别怪别人都不待见你
column6: It is no one else's fault that you were born in a poor family.

column3: 这点赏赐真叫人寒酸哪
column6: (tut) Is that all the gifts you received?

column3: 华妃娘娘赏的东西再好

column6: Consort Fleur's gifts are incomparable to Her Majesty's.

Make a dress with the textile in three days.
I will thank Her Majesty in that dress.

column3: 我穿上了再去给皇后娘娘谢恩
小主你别跟她一般见识
column6: Don't listen to her, My Lady.

column3: 我人微言轻 夏常在没说错
column6: She wasn't wrong.

column3: 小主你别灰心 英雄不问出处
column6: My Lady, your background doesn't determine your future.
My Lady, Attendant Chun is here.
Come on in!

column3: 我现在才敢过来 不算打扰吧
column6: You had a busy day, Sourire. Hope I'm not disturbing!

column3: 本来正打算过去看妹妹呢

column6: Not at all. I was just about to go visit you.

Have a seat.
Jade, make some tea.
I hope you like Pu'er tea.

column3: 你这儿有这么多好吃的点心
column6: You have so many good pastries here.

column3: 要不这个茶就先放一放
column6: I lost my appetite at dinner. Can I have some pastries?
I'll have the tea later.

column3: 流朱 再拿些点心来
column6: Go ahead!
Vermilion, bring more pastries.
It's so good!

column3: 看着妹妹年纪还小的样子
column6: You look very young.
(chewing) No, I'm fourteen.

column3: 洗碧 换杯牛乳茶来
column6:
If you don't like Pu'er ...
Jade, make milk tea.

column3: 谢谢姐姐 我就爱吃甜的

column6: Thanks, I love sweet food.
Take your time, Attendant Chun.
Please call me Chun'er. That's what my family call me.
Sure.
Was there something wrong with your dinner?
I was missing home.

column3: 御膳房送来的晚饭是糟鹅
我娘做的糟鹅是最好吃的
column6:
The Imperial Kitchen made wine-soaked goose,
and my mom is really good at cooking it.
So I felt homesick.
Come eat with me the next time you miss home!
Can I?
You're so nice to me!

column3: 听说皇上特别喜欢姐姐

column6: His Majesty really likes you.
The yard was packed with people and gifts in the afternoon.

column3: 妹妹若喜欢 就挑两支去戴
column6:
Would you like some flower hairpins?
They would look good on you!

column3: 我还是比较喜欢姐姐这儿的点心
column6: It's okay ... I like the pastries more.

column3: 浣碧 挑些精致的点心包起来
column6: Eat as much as you want.
Jade, wrap up some good ones for Chun'er.
Thank you, Sourire.
(singing)
The Imperial Garden was a feast for the eyes.

column3: 绣个花都要哼个歌唱个曲
column6:
What a loose woman!
Are you making an embroidery or a siren song?
You cannot sleep with His Majesty in the first three days.

column3: 这还不自己上赶着去呀
column6: Just wait till you can sing your way to His Majesty's bed.
I didn't mean anything like that.

column3: 常在若是不喜欢 我不唱就是了
column6: I will stop if you don't like it.

column3: 少在这儿给我摆可怜样

column6: Don't give me that face!

column3: 如今是还没有见着皇上
column6: I didn't do anything.

column3: 这来日要是见着皇上了
column6: Don't you dare seduce His Majesty with that weepy face!
Not on my watch!
Who does she think she is?
My Lady, you must not take her words seriously.
It's fine. I will leave when she's here.

column3: 你陪我去看两位姐姐吧
column6: Let's go see how my friends are doing.
Smells good,
doesn't it?
Let's get another one.
Eh, come on in!

column3: 白叫小主在日头底下晒着
column6: You should have announced the arrival of Lady An!
How could you let her wait in the sun?

column3: 姐姐别怪他是我不让传的
column6: It's not his fault. I asked him not to.
I didn't want to interrupt, but you were disturbed nonetheless.
It's not your fault.

column3: 都怪你不好 吓着安妹妹了
column6: Huan'er, you scared her.

column3: 还不快点请进来喝茶赔罪
column6: You owe her an apology.

column3: 正是呢 快进来 快进来
column6: Sorry, please come in for tea.

column3: 方才去咸福宫看眉姐姐
本想与眉姐姐一同来看甄姐姐

column6:
I went to Meizhuang's palace first, hoping to
come here with her. But she had already left.
It was good timing. Now it's time for us to catch up!

column3: 如今啊 我住在咸福宫

column6: The head of my palace, Concubine Estime, is very kind and friendly.
How about your palace?
It's not too bad.

column3: 富察贵人倒不像是个多事的
column6: Lady Fuca is all right.
But Attendant Xia ...
I will stay away from her.

column3: 那安小主可要常来咱们宫里坐坐
column6: I will spend more time with you two.

column3: 我知道小主不爱喝六安茶
column6:
You are always welcome here.
I made herbal tea instead of green tea for you.

column3: 在姐姐家里住过一段时日
浣碧倒费心事事都记着
column6:
After living for a few days at your home,
I troubled Jade to remember all my preferences.

column3: 两位小主和我家小主情同姐妹

column6:
You both treat My Lady as your sister.
I must serve you as best I can.

column3: 不想这浣碧嘴更巧 心更细呢
column6: Jade has a honeyed mouth and a sweet heart.

column3: 自然比别人多长些记性
column6: I'm grateful to have her all these years.

column3: 自然是自幼服侍咱们的好一些
column6: Of course, our dowry maids serve us the best.

column3: 我这次也是带了采月和采星过来
column6: I moved in with Lunar and Starry.

column3: 你并没有带贴身的宫女过来
column6: Lingrong, you didn't have a dowry maid.
How are the servants in your palace?

column3: 宝鹃伶俐 倒很稳妥
column6: Coua is a competent maid. I can always count on her.

column3: 还有两个小的 也不过＋五

column6: The other two are just fifteen years old, not as dependable.
Don't worry, I can take care of myself.
Jinxi!
Yes?

column3: 把菊青指去延禧宫伺候安小主
column6:
Please inform Her Majesty that
Daisy is sent away to serve Companion An.
Yes.

column3: 菊青虽年轻 却很敦厚妥当
等一下就让她跟你回去
column6:
Daisy is young but well-trained.
I'll let you have her.
Don't hesitate to tell us if you need anything else.
Thank you so much.
The textiles I received today can be made into dresses for you.

column3: 等下我就让采月给你送去延禧宫
column6: Lunar will bring them to your palace later.
I can never repay your kindness.

column3: 这份情谊陵容感激不尽
column6: I will be eternally grateful for your support and help.

column3: 你我姐妹三人一同入宫

column6: We are sisters. We look after one another.

column3: 今日是小主第一次觐见皇后
column6: My Lady, it's your first time to pay respects to Her Majesty today.
You should dress up to stand out.

column3: 这里有浣碧她们伺候就行
column6:
Please go boil water for me.
Jade will help me get dressed.
Do my hair as usual.
Your Highness, it's time to leave.
We have to be on time today.
There's no hurry.
Your Highness is uniquely stylish.

The phoenix coiffure looks incomparably distinguished.
[Phoenix is the female equivalent to the emperor's dragon]

column3: 妹妹们今天都来得这么早
column6: Let's go.
